pr_title: RHPAM-2910 - Rule Flow Group should show from which project ruleflow group is loaded

timeline.bodyText:
Although this may work, IMO using a List<Map<String, String>> is not a good practice, it's not much clear what's the data behind this instance and how to manage it...
I think would be better for example creating a class for RuleFlowGroupNames, which has 3 fields ( name, filename, pathuri ). It'll benefit as:

No need for the use of a whole Map for storing just 3 objects, also by using a class you can specify different types for each one
You'll be able to replace by List
Using a class results easier to read & understand in general
timeline.author: romartin

replies.bodyText: Yes, I also thought about it, but it will change Client/Server communication, since right now Map<String, String> it is what client expect from the backend. If Process Designer is not the only who consumes this service we need to refactor it as well. I tried to make as gentle change as possible. If you think we still need to go deeper, I can do it, no problem, just explaining my decision :)
replies.author: hasys

replies.bodyText: sorry @hasys , did a look in an IDE and noticed it's not really a big issue, we're talking jsut about a change of a return type in the private method, so the public API is not even changed, no worries, just forget this comment.
replies.author: romartin

timeline.bodyText:
maybe same logic can be addressed in less lines by using Streams, it would also help to read this method faster...
Eg: Streams.stream(groups).filter(...).map(...).collect(...)
timeline.author: romartin

replies.author: hasys

replies.bodyText: Yeah well maybe this case is not trivial, but I think it can still be improved, maybe just by using Collectors.groupingBy? I does most of the key/value handling for you... look at these examples. WDYT?
replies.author: romartin

replies.bodyText: Hi @romartin, I did a refactoring to streams, looks cleaner now, thank you!
replies.author: hasys

timeline.bodyText: can be inlined into a single return line
timeline.author: romartin
romartin

timeline.bodyText: I think it's not correct calling this method as addValues and performing a call to clear() just in the first line... shouldn't be this method just adding "more" values to the actual ones, if any, instead of clearing the actual values and then just adding the new ones? Does it makes sense to you?
timeline.author: romartin

replies.author: hasys

replies.bodyText: ok, that's fine, the implementation has not changed I see, thanks for clarifying!
replies.author: romartin

timeline.bodyText: can be inlined into a single line by using Streams
timeline.author: romartin

replies.bodyText: Not sure it is easier to read now, but maybe it is matter of taste :)
replies.author: hasys

timeline.message: RHPAM-2910 - Rule Flow Group should show from which project ruleflow group is loaded
Transition of RuleFlowGroup data from server to the UI
Combobox supports different Keys and Values Strings now
QueryService returns info about different projects with for ruleflow groups with same name.
add all groups with same group name
Do not duplicate project name for same group
